Articles.Content: The CTV-3 'Skyreach' from Galactuc Industries. Made to carry crew to a station up to 600km out and land them safely. Single stage to orbit excluding boosters.

I would enjoy seeing someone try out my BanderStar... I believe it is currently configured for asteroid interception, but you can just remove the bottom grabber module and it should be capable of getting you to the Mun or Minmus for refueling and then just about anywhere: https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/24104970/BanderStar.craft

You need to let the jets warm up before take-off and level off as soon as possible to build up speed and ascend like you would an SSTO. I ditch the ramjets when they cut out and with the mining module I start making liquid fuel once I'm in orbit.

review your craft. nice rockets, the only problem is that they weigh the craft down a lot.

 

Hey, is there any way I can get involved in the reviewing process of these crafts?

I am tying to get more experience with video editing, I already have adobe premier and a basic understanding of how to use it so I have the tools to make some pretty cool videos. I have about 1000 hours give or take a day or two in KSP so I would say i'm pretty skilled. I noticed another person who was asking about helping out with craft reviews so if you already have any help you would need covered that's fine. I also have a rather powerful computer and I can forward you my specs if you like to use me in rendering although I would be superfluous to basically uploading to YouTube. I really just want to help you with this series in any way that I can and it would be awesome if I could do so.

I have a modified version of the stock game's "Kerbal X" rocket here, and would be delighted if you could review it.

Pronouncd "Kerbal X Prime", "X Prime" or simply "Prime" for short, this vehicle is intended as an improvement of the venerable X. Designers asked Kerbonauts for suggestions of things they would like to see added to the X, and then went to work seeing how many could be integrated into an enhanced version of the classic spacecraft and launch-vehicle. The result was the Prime: a vehicle boasting several amenities that were absent from its predecessor, such as deployable sun-tracking solar-panels, retractable comms antenna, RCS thruters, crew-passable docking port, ablative heat-shield, and a revolutionary "Abort and Escape Motor" from Kerbodyne which allows the crew to abort their mission even in the event of the most severe vehicular failures, AND which carries the command-capsule with crew inside a safe distance from any potential explosions, allowing the crew to escape the ailing launch-vehicle and live to fly another day.

Although it sacrifices almost 400 meters per second of vacuum delta-V (the exact amount sacrificed is dependent upon the timing of when the escape-motor is jettisoned), designers guarantee that it can still reach the Mun using a fancy "free-return-trajectory" which is somehow a safer way to travel to the Mun, and to put itself into a tight circular orbit around the Mun. Once in that orbit around the Mun, the designers also guarantee that it will still have enough Delta-V either to land on the Mun or to return to Kerbin. They warn, however, that they are unsure whether it will have enough delta-V to return to Kerbin, or even get back into orbit around the Mun, after a Munar landing. When designers told Jeb they didn't know if the Prime can get home to Kerbin after a Munar landing, he simply said, "Watch me."

Edited August 31, 2016 by StevieC
added pic and the description that should show up when picking the craft in your launch menu from the space-center

3 minutes ago, 8bitgammers said:

oh, no. I don't, If it's a parts mod it won't work.

No, KJR is a structural enhancement mod.

KJR is Kerbal Joint Reinforcement which basically makes part joints stronger and flex less. I couldn't play without it honestly.
